alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 09 at 10:15AM CST until February 11 at 1:30PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam affecting Clarke, Wilcox and Monroe Counties. For the Alabama River...including Millers Ferry Dam, Claiborne Dam... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 40.0 feet, Considerable flooding of agricultural land. At 43.0 feet, Access to Eureka Landing community stops, with access cut off. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 46.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting at 46.8 feet this morning. It will then begin a gradual fall to below flood stage Friday morning. The river is expected to continue falling to 30.5 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 42.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
